Detailed Description

Specifies the payload format.



The following implementation is used for the HasFields methods: 

     ID | Name                 | Type
    ----+----------------------+---------------
     0  | ProcessingEfficient  | Bool
     1  | RealComplexType      | Int8
     2  | DataItemFormat       | Int8
     3  | Repeating            | Bool
     4  | EventTagSize         | Int32
     5  | ChannelTagSize       | Int32
     6  | DataItemFracSize     | Int32 - NEW in V49.2 and used only for Non-Normalized
     7  | ItemPackingFieldSize | Int32
     8  | DataItemSize         | Int32
     9  | RepeatCount          | Int32
     10 | VectorSize           | Int32
     11 | DataType             | Int64
    ----+----------------------+---------------

DataType vrt::PayloadFormat::getDataType (  )  const

Utility method: If this payload format matches one of the pre-defined data types, and is stored without any "extra bits", return that type.

Although technically "unsigned" this method will recognize any 1-bit integer data as DataType_UInt1. Note: Considers all non-normalized data types as not pre-defined.

Returns:
The data type or null if not a pre-defined type.

Referenced by vrt::StandardDataPacket::getDataType().

Reimplemented from vrt::HasFields.

virtual string vrt::PayloadFormat::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::HasFields.

virtual ValueType vrt::PayloadFormat::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.

Reimplemented from vrt::HasFields.

virtual string vrt::PayloadFormat::getValid (  )  const [virtual]

Checks to see if the payload format is valid.

This is identical to isValid() except that a description of the error is returned.

Returns:
"" if it is valid, a description of the error otherwise.

Referenced by isValid().

bool vrt::PayloadFormat::isComplex (  )  const [inline]

Utility method: Indicates if the payload format is complex.

Returns:
true if the data format is complex, false if it is real.

References getRealComplexType().

virtual bool vrt::PayloadFormat::isNullValue (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Is this object equal to null? Since the values 0x0000000000000000 and 0x8000000000000000 are both valid and 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF is invalid, this object uses -1 as the indicator for a null payload format.

Reimplemented from vrt::VRTObject.

bool vrt::PayloadFormat::isProcessingEfficient (  )  const [inline]

Indicates if the processing efficient packing method used.

Returns:
true if Processing Efficient (byte-aligned) or false if Link Efficient (fewest bytes used).
bool vrt::PayloadFormat::isRepeating (  )  const [inline]

Indicates if the sample-component repeat is used.

Returns:
true if it is being used, false if not.
